arm_group.arm_group_label: Music Group plus normal standard of care
arm_group.description: Patients will listen to music prior and during the scan

arm_group.arm_group_label: Control Group - Normal standard of care

brief_summary.textblock:
To acquire low radiation dose and good quality cardiac CT images requires scanning at low
      heart rates which is usually done with beta-blockers. However, in some patients
      beta-blockers have little effect. This is thought to be due to a different mechanism of
      action which continues to maintain the heart rate despite administration of beta-blockers.
      This study aims to look at the effect of music or relaxation tracks to reduce patient heart
      rate as anxiety is thought to play a role in maintaining high heart rates. This study will
      randomise patients into a normal standard of care group compared to a normal standard of
      care group with music/ relaxation track and compare heart rate, radiation dose, image
      quality, amount of beta-blocker used and patient experience via a State-Trait Anxiety
      Inventory (STAI) questionnaire.

clinical_study.brief_title: Relaxation Music to Lower Heart Rate Prior to Cardiac CT
condition: Coronary Artery Disease and Cardiac Anatomy
Patients Undergoing CT Pulmonary Vein Angiogram

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Age: 18 years and above

          -  All patients coming in for non-contrast enhanced calcium score CT, pulmonary vein
             angiogram, or coronary CT Angiogram

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Deaf

          -  CT for Transcatheter aortic valve implantation (TAVI) or congenital heart disease
             patients

intervention.arm_group_label: Music Group plus normal standard of care

facility.name: University Health Network, Toronto General Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: Relaxation Music to Lower Heart Rate Prior to Cardiac CT

secondary_outcome.description: Measurement tool - Likert Scale. Review of images by two highly experienced cardiac radiologists
Measuerment tool - Modified state-trait anxiety inventory (STAI) questionnaire

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor)
